Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Reintroduce Using pdb2mdb from archive" (#3170) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Opened issue "Solution that crashes on startup when aapt2 is used" (#3169) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Related to:
* https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/6327
* https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/6343

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Clone: https://github.com/zijianhuang/xamarinforms4bugs/tree/ResourcesInLib (use the ResourcesInLib branch)
2. Build/Deploy with 16.2/master
3. App crashes on start with:

```
06-04 15:47:55.260 25714 25714 I MonoDroid: Java.Lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Failed resolution of: Landroid/support/v7/appcompat/R$drawable; ---> Java.Lang.ClassNotFoundException: Didn't find class "android.support.v7.appcompat.R$drawable" on path: DexPathList[[zip file "/system/framework/org.apache.http.legacy.boot.jar", zip file "/data/app/com.companyname.Demo2.Android-PozTNMz4ZBMXaHx-doetdQ==/base.apk"],nativeLibraryDirectories=[/data/app/com.companyname.Demo2.Android-PozTNMz4ZBMXaHx-doetdQ==/lib/arm64, /data/app/com.companyname.Demo2.Android-PozTNMz4ZBMXaHx-doetdQ==/base.apk!/lib/arm64-v8a, /system/lib64]]
06-04 15:47:55.260 25714 25714 I MonoDroid:    --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
06-04 15:47:55.260 25714 25714 I MonoDroid:   at Java.Interop.JniEnvironment+InstanceMethods.CallNonvirtualVoidMethod (Java.Interop.JniObjectReference instance, Java.Interop.JniObjectReference type, Java.Interop.JniMethodInfo method, Java.Interop.JniArgumentValue* args) [0x00089] in <372c976a2c5d45cb9abb001729e14dbf>:0
06-04 15:47:55.260 25714 25714 I MonoDroid:   at Java.Interop.JniPeerMembers+JniInstanceMethods.InvokeVirtualVoidMethod (System.String encodedMember, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable self, Java.Interop.JniArgumentValue* parameters) [0x0005d] in <372c976a2c5d45cb9abb001729e14dbf>:0
06-04 15:47:55.260 25714 25714 I MonoDroid:   at Android.App.Activity.OnCreate (Android.OS.Bundle savedInstanceState) [0x00031] in <547679cba0d64c03859bc6ab9919a165>:0
06-04 15:47:55.260 25714 25714 I MonoDroid:   at Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android.FormsAppCompatActivity.OnCreate (Android.OS.Bundle savedInstanceState) [0x0001d] in <02288cf327c341c79f8385d5db4c09bf>:0
06-04 15:47:55.260 25714 25714 I MonoDroid:   at Demo2.Droid.MainActivity.OnCreate (Android.OS.Bundle savedInstanceState) [0x00001] in <16681ab0b39d4abe8efd53e748c930e4>:0
06-04 15:47:55.260 25714 25714 I MonoDroid:   at Android.App.Activity.n_OnCreate_Landroid_os_Bundle_ (System.IntPtr jnienv, System.IntPtr native__this, System.IntPtr native_savedInstanceState) [0x00011] in <547679cba0d64c03859bc6ab9919a165>:0
06-04 15:47:55.260 25714 25714 I MonoDroid:   at (wrapper dynamic-method) Android.Runtime.DynamicMethodNameCounter.7(intptr,intptr,intptr)
06-04 15:47:55.260 25714 25714 I MonoDroid:   --- End of managed Java.Lang.NoClassDefFoundError stack trace ---
```

The `obj\Debug\81\android\src\android\support\v7\appcompat\R.java` file did not exist.

If I build with `/p:AndroidUseAapt2=False`, then everything works correctly.

This solution is setup in an odd way:
* `Demo2.csproj` - forms netstandard stuff
* `Demo2.Android.csproj` - android head project, note that `@(AndroidResource)` is empty
* `ClassLibrary1.Android.csproj` - android class library with all the resources

Somehow both `<Aapt/>` and `<Aapt2Link/>` are skipped here, causing the issue:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/840039/58915020-a24b7e00-86e5-11e9-8ce5-f978e551934f.png)

### Expected Behavior

Even though this project is setup in an odd way, it should work with aapt2 enabled.

### Actual Behavior

This solution crashes on startup with aapt2 enabled.

### Version Information

16.2/master

### Log File

[Logs.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/3254554/Logs.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Profiled AOT fails using d16-2" (#3168) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new Forms application (Shell Template) in Visual Studio 2019 16.2
2. Turn on AOT and Enable Startup Tracing
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1288848/58908701-7b358200-86ce-11e9-8851-6e8a048fe218.png)
3. Build fails with assembly could not be AOT'd - https://gist.github.com/JonDouglas/926759503764aa668c2f3d7cd11701c7

[ProfiledAOTForms.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/3254219/ProfiledAOTForms.zip)

### Expected Behavior
Profiled AOT compiles and runs!

### Actual Behavior
Profiled AOT fails to compile.

### Version Information

Microsoft Visual Studio Enterprise 2019 Int Preview
Version 16.2.0 Preview 3.0 [29003.217.d16.2stg]
VisualStudio.16.IntPreview/16.2.0-pre.3.0+29003.217.d16.2stg

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Constantly have to delete or edit emulator to test code" (#3165) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Test code on Windows 10 emulator with Hyper-V enabled 
2. Exit out of emulator (pressing x on the emulator)
3. Change code (if you don't you won't get an error but it will say that the application doesn't exist at the file location it's looking for)
4. Make sure build is successful and it's not a Resouce.Designer.cs issue
5. Run the emulator again
6. App won't run
7. Edit the emulator and you'll see this 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33331184/58831190-5a572900-8609-11e9-98f5-e3f1b19f8d84.png)

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
can run the emulator multiple times or after changes and it will work

### Actual Behavior
Run the emulator first time and it's fine. Run the emulator a second time and it doesn't work. 

### Version Information
Visual studio community 2019 (installed 6/3/2019)
Android 9.0 (pie) API level 28 
Windows 10 Pro version 1809


Note: also tried to report this through Visual studio's "Send Feedback" but I click on it and it doesn't work.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Cherry pick Tizen project changes to 4.0.0 and modify SLN changes VS makes" (#6396) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###
- Cherry pick changes from https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/pull/6304 back to 4.0.0 so that I can open 4.0.0 in 16.1 and 16.2

- checkin changes that VS windows automatically makes to the SLN file so that it stops messing with me when trying to switch branches

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Cherry pick Tizen project changes to 3.6.0 and modify SLN changes VS makes" (#6407) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###
- Cherry pick changes from https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/pull/6304 back to 3.6.0  so that I can open 3.6.0 in 16.1 and 16.2

- checkin changes that VS windows automatically makes to the SLN file so that it stops messing with me when trying to switch branches

- I created a second PR for this because the 4.0 version effects project files that don't exist in 3.6 so those files would need another PR anyway

Once this is merged and merged up to 4.0.0 then https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/pull/6396 can be rebased to 4.0

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Top Padding not working on iOS when it is set alone." (#5239) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
Xamarin.Forms content page top padding is not working if it is set alone. That is if the other padding values are zero the top padding will not work. Setting one of the other values to a non zero value together with the top padding, the top padding will work.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create new Xamarin.Forms application
2. Delete the main page and add a new code only main page of type content page.
3. Create a label
Label label = new Label { Text = "Hello Xamarin World!" };
4. Set the page padding
Padding = new Thickness(0, 20, 0, 0);
5. set the label as the content property of the page
Content = label;

### Expected Behavior
The label should have been displayed 20 units below the iOS status bar

### Actual Behavior
The label is overlapping with the iOS status bar

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.5.0.129452
- Last known good version: I don't remeber (but I guess it was working fine on the earlier version of 3.2.0.871581
- IDE: Visual Studio 2017
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  <!-- The version of the iOS SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 12.1 -->
- Nuget Packages: NetStandardLibrary 2.0.3
- Affected Devices: 

### Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8667389/52732876-4f34aa80-2fd2-11e9-9eb6-a3626e62709f.png)

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

### Reproduction Link

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "[Core] Incorrect increments in Stepper" (#5192) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Stepper control with a small increment may sets incorrect value.
So we need to avoid values which aren't in STEP (Increment) sequence.

### Issues Resolved ### 

- fixes #5168 

### API Changes ###

None

### Platforms Affected ### 
- Core

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###
Stepper works properly with small Increment value

### Before/After Screenshots ### 
Not applicable

### Testing Procedure ###

* run Control Gallery > Stepper Gallery - Legacy
* click 3 times on latest `+` button
* click 3 times on `-` button

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Android] Fixed applying effects to Frames" (#6412) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Added *VisualElementRenderer* field as observer of Android Frame renderer (combination of gesture / effects listeners) instead of separate listeners (the same approach with Label's fast renderer.

### Issues Resolved ### 

- fixes https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/3548

### API Changes ###

None

### Platforms Affected ### 

- Android

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###

It's possible to adjust effects to frames

### Before/After Screenshots ### 

Not applicable

### Testing Procedure ###

Described in original issue ticket. Please check: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/3548

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[xtro] Exclude some frameworks that cause issues with sharpie on macOS 10.15" (#6207) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Also merge new `MPSNDArray` into its parent `MetalPerformanceShaders`
and use a `SortedSet` to avoid ending up with both `PdfKit` and `PDFKit`

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Meta] Xcode 11 Support" (#6206) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
This is a meta issue tracking the status of our Xcode 11 support.

As we progress, we'll update it, but you can always see the latest status in our [branch](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/tree/xcode11) and our [public development channel](https://gitter.im/xamarin/xamarin-macios).

**Status**: We are currently working on producing working mono and macios builds using the new Xcode compiler.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Xcode 11] Simulator provisioning got disabled in the Xcode 11 branch " (#6205) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody: We had to disable the simulator provisioning here https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/pull/6204 to get the project to compile with Xcode 11 beta 1and unblock the bindings. We should re-enable it when possible.
